chapter.title: Actualizando Pacotes
chapter.para: If you have been around Linux distributions for any amount of time, you have realized that there are sometimes bugs in programs. In the Debian and Ubuntu distributions, bugs are often fixed through the packaging by patching the source code. Sometimes there are bugs in the packaging itself that can cause difficulties.

To patch the program's source code, you could simply download the current Ubuntu source package (with apt-get source) and make the needed changes. You can then add a new entry to the debian/changelog using dch -i or dch -v <version>-<revision> to specify the new revision. When you run debuild -S from the source directory you will have a new source package with a new .diff.gz in the parent directory that contains your changes. A problem with this approach is that the distinction between source and patches is unclear.

Uma solução para este problema é separar as mudanças ao código fonte em correcções individuais armazenadas no directório debian. Este sistema de correcção é chamado dpatch. As correcções são armazenadas no directório debian/patches/ e têm um formato especial.
Para criar uma dpatch, execute os passos seguintes sequencialmente.
Crie um espaço de trabalho temporário e duas cópias da directória fonte actual:
chapter.screen: mkdir tmp cd tmp cp -a ../<package>-<version> . cp -a <package>-<version> <package>-<version>.orig
chapter.para: Crie um ficheiro de correcção usando o diff e colocando-o na directoria do debian/patches.
Crie o dpatch usando dpatch patch-template e um ficheiro chamado 00list que lista os dpatches:
Agora pode colocar o 01_patchname.dpatch e 00list na directória debian/patches do seu pacote fonte.

note.para: Pode também editar uma correcção já existente usando o dpatch-edit-patch.

chapter.para: Assim que todas as mudanças estiverem efectuadas, uma entrada adicionada no changelog, e o dpatch adicionado ao ficheiro debian/control (se necessário), então pode reconstruir o pacote fonte com debuild -S.

To get your fixed source package uploaded to the Ubuntu repositories, you will need to get your source package sponsored by a person who has upload rights. See for more details. Sometimes, rather than giving the entire source package (.diff.gz, .dsc, and .orig.tar.gz), it is easier and more efficient to just give the difference between the source package that is currently in the repositories and your fixed source package. A tool has been created to do just that called debdiff. Using debdiff is similar to using diff but is made specifically for packaging. You can debdiff the source package by:
Debdiffs are great to attach to bug reports and have ready for a sponsor to upload.
